intro: Cynanchum liukiuense, commonly known as the Ryukyu milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the Ryukyu Islands of Japan. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. Its latex is milky and can be toxic, which is a common feature among members of its family. Cynanchum liukiuense is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas.
